snippet: The London police apologized Monday to the family of a British newspaper vendor who died after an officer hit him with a baton during protests of a Group of 20 meeting in 2009.
abstract: London police apologize to family of Ian Tomlinson, British newspaper vendor who died after Police Officer Simon Harwood hit him with baton during protests against Group of 20 meeting in 2009.
lead_paragraph: The London police apologized Monday to the family of a British newspaper vendor who died after an officer hit him with a baton during protests of a Group of 20 meeting in 2009.

headline.main: Britain: Police Apologize for Vendor’s Death at Protest
headline.print_headline: Britain: Police Apologize for Vendor’s Death at Protest
